contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox boxer |name = Quincy Taylor |image = |image_size = |realname = Quincy Taylor |nickname = |weight = [[Middleweight]] |height = {{height|ft=5|in=9}} |reach = |nationality = [[United States|American]] |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1963|07|18}} |birth_place = [[Dallas]], [[Texas]], United States |style = [[Southpaw stance|Southpaw]] |total = 32 |wins = 28 |losses = 4 |draws = 0 |no contests = |KO = 24 |medaltemplates = |show-medals = }} '''Quincy Taylor''' (born July 18, 1963 in [[Dallas, Texas]]), was a professional [[boxing|boxer]] in the [[Middleweight]] (160[[pound (mass)|lb]]) division. Taylor, a [[southpaw]], turned pro in 1986. In 1987, he nearly KO´d Sugar Ray Leonard whilst sparring in preparation for Leonard's match against World Middleweight Champion 'Marvelous' Marvin Hagler. In 1994 landed a shot at [[World Boxing Council|WBC]] Middleweight Title holder [[Julian Jackson]]. Taylor scored a shocking upset TKO victory over Jackson, but lost the title in his next fight to [[Keith Holmes (boxer)|Keith Holmes]]. After a two year layoff and a victory in 1998, followed by a three year layoff and a victory in 2001, Taylor retired from boxing. In 2010 he works at Fed-ex for the City of Lufkin. When he is not working, he is coaching the amateur boxers at the Boys and Girls Club. He trains alongside with them. {{s-start}} {{succession box| before= [[Julian Jackson]]| title=[[World Boxing Council|WBC]] [[List of middleweight boxing champions|Middleweight Champion]]| after=[[Keith Holmes (boxer)|Keith Holmes]]| years=19 Aug 1995 – 16 Mar 1996}} {{s-end}} == See also == * [[List of WBC world champions]] == External links == * {{Boxrec|id=000545}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Taylor, Quincy | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American boxer | DATE OF BIRTH = July 18, 1963 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Taylor, Quincy}} [[Category:1963 births]] [[Category:Boxers from Texas]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Middleweight boxers]] [[Category:World boxing champions]] [[Category:People from Dallas, Texas]]
